result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew P. Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Collected by the clerk of courts.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM case called. Defendant Matthew P. Schmidt in court without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. 
Defendant waives right to counsel. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to count 4: disorderly conduct. Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Court orders defendant to pay court costs including the DNA surcharge. Defendant ordered to provide fingerprints.

Conditions: 
No acts or threats against anyone.

11:47 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew P. Schmidt in court without counsel. 
Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 8-22-22 at 2:30 PM. 
Return to court: 9-14-22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
For Initial Appearance on 08/03/2022 at 11:00 a.m.
